content.description: Thin cracks and gear bring you up over the roof. Aim for the ring piton using crisp edges. From the pin climb straight up searching for pro along the way. As it steepens up there is a fixed angle, from here make a hard move to a right ward traverse that will bring you to the anchor
content.protection: 2 pins A full rack of TCU's and a couple of handsized cams, QD's. Maybe some webbing for the anchor.
content.location: Start at the "top" of the "hill" on the golden slab. This is about 100 ft. up from $70 Commitment

content.description: This starts in a left to right crack that you pass a piton or 2 along the way. Establish yourself on the arete and pad your way past 2 bolts and some gear to the top. A sweet belay ledge awaits you at the top. Enjoy the view.
content.protection: A light rack w/ some TCU's and a couple of handsized cams will suffice.
content.location: This start is about 10 feet to the right of Waiting for the Worm. Descend from 2 bolt anchor

content.description: The start is thin fingers to tips. Step up and clip a pin, a hand jam and some off finger locks (for me) brings you to a wild rightward traverse on fingerlocks. From the lip throw up and around and enjoy the fun slab to the anchor
content.location: This is the first route you will encounter on Team Serious Wall. It starts under the overhang on flat-ish ground. This is actually the walk off for the 1st pitch of Commitment.

content.description:
Don't look for Weapons of Mass Destruction on this pitch, you won't find them here either.

Start on the arete around the corner from the $70 Commitment. Climb up to a horizontal and shuffle out left stretching for a out of reach nut or TCU placement. Climb up the slightly broken section for a few feet then scoot out left and up the scoop. At the top of the scoop clip a bolt and ramble to the anchor.
content.protection: A set of TCU's and nutz. Doubles on #0 & #1 metolius nice but not necessary. A shoulder sling or 2.
content.location: Around the corner (east) from the $70 Commitment about 20 feet. Descend from ring anchor and slung tree.
